text: The 2011 Wan Chai District Council election was held on 6 November 2011 to elect all 11 elected members to the 13-member District Council. The pro- Beijing camp remained control of the council with the Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong retained the largest party status with three seats. In Broadwood, incumbent Michael Mak Kwok-fung of the pro- democracy League of Social Democrats lost to independent Pamela Peck Wan-kam. ==Overall election results== Before election: {| style="width:50%; text- align:center;" |+ ↓ |- style="color:white;" | style="background:green; width:36%;" | 4 | style="background:red; width:64%;" | 7 |- | Pro-democracy | Pro-Beijing |} Change in composition: {| style="width:50%; text-align:center;" |+ ↓ |- style="color:white;" | style="background:green; width:18.18%;" | 2 | style="background:red; width:81.82%;" | 9 |- | PD | Pro-Beijing |} ==Results by constituency== ===Broadwood=== ===Canal Road=== ===Causeway Bay=== ===Happy Valley=== ===Hennessy=== ===Jardine's Lookout=== ===Oi Kwan=== ===Southorn=== ===Stubbs Road=== ===Tai Fat Hau=== ===Tai Hang=== ==References== Category:2011 Hong Kong local elections Category:Wan Chai District Council elections
title: 2011 Wan Chai District Council election
